event.summary: 01/21/1993: Twenty people were injured in a car bomb explosion in Bogota, Colombia. The attack caused extensive damage over an 8 block radius. Although no one claimed the attack, police blamed it on drug traffickers, however a specific group name was not disclosed.
event.weapdetail: 80 pounds of explosives were left in the vehicle.
event.propcomment: The attack caused extensive damage over an 8 block radius.
event.addnotes: No perpetrators were identified, but the police suspected drug traffickers.
event.scite1: “Escobar blamed for bomb blasts that injure 17,” The Associated Press, January 22, 1993.
event.scite2: “Colombia- 20 injured in car bomb explosion,” IPS-Inter Press Service, January 22, 1993.
event.scite3: “Bomb blasts in Bogota wound at least 17,” Los Angeles Times, January 23, 1993.
